page.title: 02THE TOWN OF PETERSFIELD
page.content: {Petersfield}was created as a new town about 800 years ago. It took its name from the church of St. Peter's-in-the- fields which was a chapel of the church at Buriton. There are still some old buildings, especially around the Square, as well as some modern ones, such as the Library and some new factories in a small industrial estate on the edge of the town. Here are the factories of Whitmans Laboratories, Estee Lauder Cosmetics, and the older established firm of Henry Willis, Organ Builders. I.T.S. Rubber have an older factory near the town centre. A feature of the Square is the lead statue of William III. He has no connection with Petersfield, but Sir William Jolliffe MP left money for it to be erected. It was made in l753 by John Cheere, sculptor, of London.
